subject: Career
title: Structural Holes: The Power Position
description: A fast breakdown of Structural Holes: The Power Position for builders.

hook.text: Two teams in the same company never talk. You know people on both. You just became the most powerful person.

buildup.text: Ron Burt's 'structural holes' theory: gaps between groups create opportunities for the people who bridge them.

discovery.text: Bridges control information flow. They see opportunities that people inside closed groups cannot.

twist.text: This explains why cross-functional people get promoted faster â€” they fill structural holes.

climax.text: Map your network. If everyone you know also knows each other, you have no structural holes to exploit.

punchline.text: Power isn't in the group. It's in the gap between groups.

quiz.question: What are structural holes in network theory?
options: Gaps between groups that create power for those who bridge them
